references.paper_title: Computing the bias of constant-step stochastic approximation with Markovian noise
references.reason: This paper provides a detailed analysis of the bias in constant-stepsize stochastic approximation with Markovian noise, which is directly relevant to the current work's investigation of SA with both Markovian data and nonlinear updates.

references.paper_title: Bridging the gap between constant step size stochastic gradient descent and Markov chains
references.reason: This paper provides a rigorous analysis of the asymptotic behavior of constant-stepsize stochastic gradient descent (SGD) with Markovian data, offering insights into the convergence properties and bias characterization, which are highly relevant to the current paper's study of constant-stepsize SA with Markovian data and nonlinear updates.

references.paper_title: Finite-sample analysis of nonlinear stochastic approximation with applications in reinforcement learning
references.reason: This paper provides finite-sample error bounds for nonlinear stochastic approximation under constant stepsizes, which is crucial for understanding the non-asymptotic behavior of SA algorithms that are the focus of the current work.

references.paper_title: Stationary behavior of constant stepsize SGD type algorithms: An asymptotic characterization
references.reason: This work offers an asymptotic analysis of the stationary distribution of constant-stepsize SGD algorithms, directly relevant to the current work's investigation into the asymptotic bias of SA iterates under constant stepsizes and Markovian data.

references.paper_title: Stochastic Approximation: A Dynamical Systems Viewpoint
references.reason: This book provides a comprehensive overview of the theory and applications of stochastic approximation, serving as a foundational resource for the current paper's theoretical analysis of SA with Markovian data and nonlinear updates.
